pdf.intro: This material contains activities organized by level: beginner, intermediate, and advanced. They can be done at home or in the classroom using simple resources.
pdf.intro_instructions: This page contains instructions for assembling the games.

sections.beginner_content: Activities focused on literacy and first contact with words.

beginner_games.title: Weekly Schedule
instructions: Create your weekly schedule.

beginner_games.title: World Map
beginner_games.summary: Recognize the country where you were born and where you are now.
instructions: Color blue the country where you were born.
Color yellow the country where you are now.

beginner_games.title: Draw Your Origin
beginner_games.summary: Introduce yourself and draw your country of origin.
instructions: Write your name, age, and nationality in your mother language.
Draw your country of origin.
Write your name, age, and nationality in Portuguese.

beginner_games.title: Introduction
beginner_games.summary: Introduce yourself and draw the flag of your country of origin.
instructions: Write your name, age, and nationality in your mother language.
Draw the flag of your country of origin.

beginner_games.title: My Family
instructions: Draw your family.
Write the name of each family member.

beginner_games.title: Tell Your Story
beginner_games.summary: Tell your story to the class.
instructions: Tell your story to the class.

beginner_games.title: Color Hunt
beginner_games.summary: Find objects matching the colors in the list.
instructions: Find and draw objects that match the colors in the list.

beginner_games.title: Alphabet Letters
beginner_games.summary: Recognize and form words using alphabet letters.
instructions: Form words using alphabet letters.
Form simple equations and basic numbers.

beginner_games.title: Memory Game – Image and Word
beginner_games.summary: Match images with the corresponding words.
instructions: Shuffle the cards and place them face down on the table.
Players take turns flipping two cards to find matching pairs.
The player with the most pairs at the end wins.

beginner_games.title: Alphabet Bingo
instructions: The teacher or guardian draws letters from a bag and announces them aloud.
Players mark the corresponding letter on their card.
The first to complete a line or the entire card wins.

beginner_games.title: Object Hunt
beginner_games.summary: Identify objects based on written or spoken clues.
instructions: Say the word or show the written card.
Children must find the object in the environment.
The first to bring the correct object earns a point.

sections.intermediate_content: Activities to expand vocabulary and form simple sentences.

intermediate_games.title: Word Domino
instructions: Distribute the pieces among the players.
Players take turns placing pieces to form correct words.
The first to use all their pieces wins.

intermediate_games.title: Hangman (adapted)
intermediate_games.summary: Guess the secret word by suggesting letters.
instructions: Choose a simple word and draw blank spaces on paper.
Players suggest letters one at a time.
For each mistake, draw part of a figure (e.g., stick figure).
The goal is to guess the word before the drawing is completed.

intermediate_games.title: Sentence Building
intermediate_games.summary: Form simple sentences using word cards.
instructions: Distribute the cards among the players.
Players take turns forming short sentences using at least 3 cards.
The group votes for the funniest or most creative sentence.

sections.advanced_content: Activities for reading comprehension, logical reasoning, and storytelling.

advanced_games.title: Story Continuation
advanced_games.summary: Create a collaborative story by adding sentences in turns.
instructions: The first player starts a story with a sentence card.
Each player continues the story with a new sentence card.
The story ends when everyone agrees to finish.
At the end, read the full story aloud.

advanced_games.title: Word Search
advanced_games.summary: Find hidden words in a letter grid.
instructions: Distribute the grids to the players.
Players must find all the listed words.
The first to find them all wins.

advanced_games.title: Fun Debate
advanced_games.summary: Practice argumentation and reasoning through debates.
instructions: Divide players into two groups.
Choose a simple topic (e.g., 'Books are better than TV').
Each group prepares 2–3 arguments.
Groups take turns presenting arguments, and the audience/teacher decides the winner.
